episodeTitle: The Captains Square Off! The Final Combat Round!
japanesisedTitle: キャプテン対決！最終戦コンバット！
description: Luffy and Foxy face off in the final event of the Davy Back Fight - the Combat round. With Chopper already taken by Foxy after the second round, Nami negotiates to raise the stakes. Luffy enters the ring wearing an afro, convinced by Usopp that it will make him stronger. The battle begins aboard the Sexy Foxy, with Foxy using his Noro Noro Beam and various dirty tricks against Afro Luffy.

events.title: Nami Negotiates Higher Stakes
events.description: Following Foxy's reclamation of Chopper after the second round, Nami steps forward to negotiate with Foxy. She convinces him to raise the stakes of the final Combat round, allowing the winner to claim 500 crew members instead of just one. This negotiation means Luffy can potentially reclaim both Chopper and Robin if he wins.
events.significance: Raises the stakes of the Combat round and demonstrates Nami's strategic thinking, giving Luffy the opportunity to reclaim both lost crew members in a single match.

quotes.text: If you're so confident, why not make it more interesting? Let's raise the stakes to 500 crew members!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami challenges Foxy to increase the wager

events.title: Afro Luffy Makes His Debut
events.description: Luffy emerges for the Combat round wearing a large black afro wig, having been convinced by Usopp that the afro will unlock his deepest latent powers and make his punches stronger. He also sports a flaming skull and crossbones tattoo across his midsection. The sight shocks both crews, though Usopp insists the hairstyle will bring out Luffy's true fighting spirit.
events.significance: Introduces one of the most iconic and comedic moments in One Piece, with Afro Luffy becoming a beloved fan-favorite transformation. While played for laughs, it represents Luffy's willingness to try anything to save his crew members.

quotes.text: The hairstyle will unlock your deepest latent powers! The afro will make your punch stronger!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp convinces Luffy to wear the afro

quotes.text: Is it the afro that's the champion, or is the champion the afro?
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp's philosophy on the power of the afro

events.title: Combat Round Begins: Luffy vs Foxy
events.description: The final round of the Davy Back Fight officially begins. The Combat is a one-on-one battle between the two captains with specific rules: the entire Sexy Foxy ship and everything within a 100-meter radius of the mast is the arena, any weapons or Devil Fruit abilities are allowed, there is no time limit, and victory is achieved by knocking the opponent out of the arena. Foxy enters with a record of 920 consecutive wins.
events.significance: Marks the climactic showdown of the Davy Back Fight arc, with the fate of Chopper and Robin hanging in the balance. The unique rules and arena setup create a distinctive battle environment.

quotes.text: The arena is the entire Sexy Foxy and everything within 100 meters of the mast! The first one knocked out of the ring loses!
quotes.speaker: Referee

events.title: Foxy Uses Noro Noro Beam on Luffy's Attack
events.description: As Luffy immediately launches a Gomu Gomu no Pistol to start the fight, Foxy counters with his Noro Noro Beam, slowing down Luffy's stretched fist. The slowed fist becomes easy to dodge, and Luffy is shocked to find his arm won't return to normal speed, remaining stretched out and vulnerable for 30 seconds while under the beam's effect.
events.significance: Demonstrates the effectiveness of Foxy's Devil Fruit ability against Luffy's rubber powers, establishing the tactical challenge Luffy faces. Shows that Foxy's seemingly weak power can neutralize even powerful opponents through clever application.

events.title: Foxy Unveils Kyubi Rush Technique
events.description: Taking advantage of Luffy being slowed by the Noro Noro Beam, Foxy unleashes his Kyubi Rush technique - a rapid barrage of punches delivered while Luffy is in slow motion. Luffy cannot feel the impacts while slowed, but when the 30-second effect wears off, he experiences all the accumulated damage from the punches at once, sending him reeling.
events.significance: Reveals one of Foxy's signature combat techniques that exploits his Devil Fruit's unique property of delayed impact. Demonstrates how Foxy compensates for his lack of physical strength through tactical use of his powers.

quotes.speaker: Foxy
quotes.context: Foxy unleashes a barrage of punches on the slowed Luffy

events.title: Foxy Deploys Noro Noro Foxy Face Bombs
events.description: Foxy reveals another weapon in his arsenal - the Foxy Face Bombs. These are small explosive devices shaped like miniature versions of Foxy's face that can be launched at opponents. The bombs explode on impact, creating additional danger for Luffy while he's trying to deal with the slowed effects.
events.significance: Shows Foxy's reliance on gadgets and weapons to supplement his Devil Fruit powers, establishing his fighting style as heavily tactical and equipment-based rather than raw power.

events.title: Foxy Reveals Spiked Boxing Gloves
events.description: After landing several hits on Luffy, Foxy reveals that he has switched from his regular boxing gloves to spiked ones. The metal spikes increase the damage of his punches significantly, catching Luffy off guard. Combined with his other tactics, this weapon makes Foxy's attacks much more dangerous despite his relatively weak physical strength.
events.significance: Further establishes Foxy's fighting philosophy of using any means necessary to win, including dirty tricks and concealed weapons. Demonstrates why he has won 920 consecutive Davy Back Fights despite not being physically powerful.

quotes.text: Did you think I'd play fair? These spiked gloves will make sure you feel every hit!
quotes.speaker: Foxy
quotes.context: Foxy reveals his spiked gloves to the shocked Luffy

events.title: Luffy Experiences Accumulated Damage
events.description: After the Noro Noro Beam's effect wears off, Luffy experiences all the accumulated damage from Foxy's Kyubi Rush, the spiked gloves, and the Foxy Face Bomb explosions hitting him simultaneously. The delayed impact sends Luffy flying and causes significant damage, demonstrating the dangerous effectiveness of Foxy's combination tactics.
events.significance: Illustrates the tactical danger of the Noro Noro no Mi's ability - attacks that seem harmless during the slowdown period deliver their full force all at once, creating overwhelming damage that would normally be spread out over time.

quotes.text: The hairstyle will unlock your deepest latent powers! The afro will make your punch stronger!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Convincing Luffy to wear the afro

quotes.text: Is it the afro that's the champion, or is the champion the afro?
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp's philosophy about the power of the afro

quotes.text: If you're so confident, why not make it more interesting? Let's raise the stakes to 500 crew members!
quotes.speaker: Nami
Foxy
quotes.context: Using his Devil Fruit power against Luffy

quotes.text: Did you think I'd play fair? These spiked gloves will make sure you feel every hit!
quotes.speaker: Foxy

themes.description: The episode emphasizes how clever tactics and strategic use of abilities can overcome superior physical strength. Foxy's use of his Devil Fruit, gadgets, and dirty tricks demonstrates that intelligence and cunning can be as effective as raw power in battle.
themes.symbolism: Foxy's 920-win streak represents the triumph of strategy over strength, while Luffy's straightforward approach is challenged by an opponent who refuses to fight conventionally.

themes.description: Luffy's willingness to wear the afro, despite how ridiculous it looks, shows his determination to save his crew members by any means necessary. The episode highlights the importance of adaptability in the face of unexpected challenges.
themes.symbolism: The afro symbolizes Luffy's willingness to step outside his comfort zone and try unconventional approaches to protect his nakama.

culturalReferences.description: The afro is reminiscent of legendary boxers from the 1970s, particularly those known for their fighting spirit and determination. Usopp's claim about the afro's power references this cultural association between afros and boxing champions.

themes.description: The high stakes of the battle underscore the depth of loyalty within the Straw Hat crew. Luffy is fighting to reclaim Chopper and Robin, demonstrating that no crew member will be left behind.
themes.symbolism: The raised stakes to 500 crew members emphasize how invaluable each individual crew member is to Luffy - he's willing to risk everything to get them back.

characterSpotlights.role: Protagonist fighting to reclaim his crew members
characterSpotlights.development: Shows Luffy's willingness to embrace unconventional tactics (wearing the afro) and adapt to an opponent whose fighting style is completely different from what he's faced before. Demonstrates his determination to save Chopper and Robin.
keyActions: Wears the afro at Usopp's suggestion
Enters the Combat round with confidence
Launches immediate attack with Gomu Gomu no Pistol
Experiences the tactical challenge of Foxy's Noro Noro powers
Endures accumulated damage from Foxy's combination attacks
quotes: I'm gonna get Chopper and Robin back, no matter what!

characterSpotlights.development: Showcases his complete fighting style, demonstrating why he has achieved 920 consecutive victories in Davy Back Fights despite lacking physical power. His reliance on tricks, gadgets, and tactical use of his Devil Fruit ability is fully displayed.
keyActions: Agrees to raise the stakes to 500 crew members
Uses Noro Noro Beam to counter Luffy's attacks
Uses spiked boxing gloves as a dirty trick
quotes: Did you think I'd play fair? These spiked gloves will make sure you feel every hit!

characterSpotlights.development: Acts as Luffy's corner man during the fight, showing his support for his captain. His insistence on the afro's power, while comedic, demonstrates his belief in creative solutions and his desire to help Luffy in any way he can.
keyActions: Convinces Luffy to wear the afro
Acts as Luffy's coach during the fight
Holds Luffy's straw hat during the battle
quotes: The hairstyle will unlock your deepest latent powers!
Is it the afro that's the champion, or is the champion the afro?

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates her strategic thinking and negotiation skills by convincing Foxy to raise the stakes, giving Luffy the opportunity to reclaim both Chopper and Robin in one match. Shows her intelligence and confidence in Luffy's abilities.
keyActions: Negotiates with Foxy to raise the stakes to 500 crew members
Watches the battle with concern for Luffy
quotes: If you're so confident, why not make it more interesting?

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime version of the Davy Back Fight has been extended with additional rounds not present in the manga. Episode 217 itself closely follows the manga chapters 313-314, but the overall arc has more content in the anime.
Some of Foxy's weapons and gadgets receive more screen time and detailed animation in the anime, particularly the Foxy Face Bombs which are shown with more elaborate explosions.

trivia.fact: Episode 217 aired with an 11.8% television rating in Japan, ranking 3rd in its timeslot.

Afro Luffy has become one of the most beloved and memed moments in One Piece history, despite only appearing in a few episodes. Fans often cite it as proof that Luffy's most powerful form is not Gear 5, but Afro Luffy.

sources.title: Afro Luffy: Unforgettable Davy Back Fight

trivia.fact: This episode marks the beginning of the Combat round, which was Foxy's 921st Davy Back Fight, having won all 920 previous matches.
Episode 207 (which began this opening) was the first One Piece episode to be broadcast in widescreen HD format, and 'Kokoro no Chizu' was the first opening filmed for the new format.

sources.title: Kokoro no Chizu - One Piece Wiki
